ReportSection.title: Section 1 - Administrative Information
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please read all questions within this application form very carefully since some questions may be different from the previous draft application document provided on CFN’s website.

Please read the Program Guidelines and Application Instructions before completing this application form.

Completed application packages are due by Friday March 15, 2019 – 5 pm ET.

Please provide all information in English.

ReportSection.ReportItem: Please provide the following information: {$item}

ReportItem.options: Yes, I expect that this research will require an ethics review|No, I do not expect that this research will require an ethics review

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Ethics/Environmental Assessment

Please answer the two questions below.

  1. Ethics Approval: If the proposed study involves biohazards, humans, human embryonic stem cells or animals, AND is funded by CFN, certification of approval by your institutional certification committee must be provided to CFN prior to the release of funds.{$item}

ReportItem.options: Yes, I expect that this research will require an environmental impact review|No, I do not expect that this research will require an environmental impact review

ReportSection.ReportItem: • Environmental Assessment: Does any phase or part of the research described in this proposal a) take place outside an office or laboratory, or b) involve an undertaking as described in part 1 of Appendix B of the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC) Form 101 (http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca/OnlineServices-ServicesEnLigne/pdf/F101_e.pdf)?.{$item} If you answered yes to this question, and your project is funded, you will need to complete an Environmental Assessment Impact Statement and the Canadian Environmental Assessment Act Pre-Screening Checklist for review and approval by CFN before funds will be released.

ReportSection.name: 2 - Proposal Summary
ReportSection.title: Section 2 - Proposal Summary
ReportSection.ReportItem:
2.1: Lay Summary

Provide a non-confidential summary of the KT proposal in lay terms. A lay summary is an overview of a research project described in a way that can be easily understood by those without prior experience of the subject. It is not a slight modification of the scientific abstract or a simplification of the study; a well-written lay summary allows the public to understand research and its value, impact, and applications. Lay summaries also help juries evaluate research grant applications and facilitate use of the research by government, the public and private sectors, and the community at large. (For funded KT proposals, this summary will be used externally in media releases, communications and posted on the CFN’s website.)

{$item}

2.2: Scientific Summary

Provide a non-confidential scientific summary of the KT proposal, highlighting the study objectives, milestones, deliverables and potential socioeconomic impact. (For funded KT proposals, this summary will be used externally in media releases, communications and posted on the CFN’s website.)

{$item}

ReportSection.name: 3 - KT Proposal
ReportSection.title: Section 3 - KT Proposal
ReportSection.ReportItem:
3.1: Concept

3.1.1: Quality of the Idea

  1. Please clearly describe the overall goal and objectives of the study and provide distinct outputs that support advances in health-related knowledge, health research, health care, health systems, and/or health outcomes for the care of Canadians living with frailty.
  2. Please clearly describe the hypothesis and rationale of the study and articulate why this proposal is considered to have the potential to change the care of older Canadians living with frailty.
  3. Please clearly describe how you plan on measuring and evaluating the impact of your proposal on the care of older adults living with frailty.
{$item}

3.1.2: Importance of the Idea

Please clearly describe how the study will contribute to advancing health-related knowledge, health research, health care, health systems and/or health outcomes related to the care of Canadians living with frailty.

{$item}

3.2: Feasibility

3.2.1: Approach

  1. Please describe the approaches and methods used in this study and why they are appropriate to meet the goals and objectives and deliver upon the proposed output(s). The proposal should be developed using an appropriate KT strategy based on a KT framework identified in the April 2012 Knowledge Translation Framework for Ageing and Health from the World Health Organization (http://www.who.int/ageing/publications/knowledge_translation.pdf). In addition to the budget justification you provided in the budget template, please provide any additional budget justification as it relates to the approaches and methods.
  2. Please provide timelines showing when goals, objectives and outputs will be reached.
  3. Please describe the potential barriers and challenges related to achieving the proposed goals and objectives and how you intend on overcoming these barriers and challenges. What is your mitigation strategy?
{$item}

3.2.2: Expertise, Experience and Resources

  1. Please describe the expertise and experience of each Principal Investigator, Co-investigator, Partner and other critical team member to show that he/she can lead and deliver on the proposed outputs and achieve the goals and objectives of this proposal.
  2. Please provide an estimate on the number of hours per week (contribution) for each Principal Investigator, Co-investigator, Partner and other critical team member that will be working on the study and describe why this is an appropriate level of engagement and/or commitment to deliver the proposed outputs and achieve the goals and objectives of this proposal. (Note: All Individuals participating as project team members will also need to be listed in the Project Team List document).
  3. For each Principal Investigator, Co-investigator, Partner and other critical team member please describe why the environment (academic institution and/or other organization) is appropriate to enable the conduct and success of the project?
{$item}

3.3: Capacity Building - Highly Qualified Personnel (HQP)

CFN funded proposals must contribute to the development of HQP through their inclusion as fully involved team members. Describe the number of HQP and their level of training/experience and role/activities for the study and the number of hours per week that each will be working on the study.

{$item}

3.4: Project Networking and Engagement

  1. Describe the networking and engagement planned for this project across disciplines and sectors. Projects must represent a collaborative effort of different Investigators in more than one discipline and at more than one Institution.
  2. Describe how knowledge users (e.g. patients/families, decision makers, stakeholders, practitioners) will be involved in the KT study in a meaningful manner. For clarity, meaningfully involved participation of knowledge users includes assisting in the planning and execution of the study.
{$item}

ReportSection.name: 4 - Additional Information
ReportSection.title: Section 4 - Additional Information
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Tables and Figures

Provide tables, figures, and a list of references relevant to Section 3 as a single PDF.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: 5 - Partnerships
ReportSection.title: Section 5 - Partnerships & Letters of Support

ReportItem.labels: Eligible Partner Organization(s)|Potential Conflict of Interest|Partner’s Role in Study and Specific Use of Contribution in Study|Nature of Contribution|Contribution Amount (CDN$)

ReportSection.ReportItem:
• Complete the table below.
  • In a single PDF document, please provide letters of support for each partner, collaborator etc. Upload this document. Make sure that each letter of support within the PDF is on the organization’s letterhead, detailing the partnership and specifically indicating their cash and/or in-kind contribution. The letter should specifically include reference to CFN, the proposed study, and any conditions placed on funding. See Application Instructions for guidance on allowable expenses and eligible partners and contributions.
  • Individuals from the partner organizations that will be participating as project team members must be listed in the submitted Project Team Information document.
  • All financial information provided in the table below must also appear in the submitted budget document.
  • Where a researcher has a “financial interest” (as defined by NCE Conflict of Interest Guidelines) in a partner, the potential conflict of interest should be declared in the table. This does not preclude the partnership in any way, but provides transparency during the review process. Please see CFN Conflict of Interest Policy and Guidelines for additional guidance http://www.cfn-nce.ca/media/23963/cfn-conflict-of-interest-policy.pdf
{$item}

Letters of Support

Upload a single PDF document containing all of the letters of support.

{$item}
